oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Cracker Barrel Show - Grant Turner - 1976-09-25 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First recording contains excerpts from a Fender banjo sponsored Grand Ole Opry Show featuring Connie Smith (performer), Justin Tubb (performer), and Minnie Pearl (performer) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.) Second recording contains excerpts from a Grand Ole Opry show featuring Roy Acuff and the Smoky Mountain Boys (performers) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.) Third recording contains excerpts from a Cracker Barrel Show from September 24, 1976. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer) playing record excerpts.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Connie Smith; Justin Tubb; Ira Louvin; Minnie Pearl; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- ('Till) I Kissed You (Connie Smith) -- [Unidentified] talks -- Fender Banjo commercial (Rex Allen) -- Minnie Pearl talks about knowing all the stars when they were young -- Minnie Pearl introduces Justin Tubb -- Keep Me From Blowing Away (Justin Tubb) -- Minnie Pearl talks about the CB Club in Centerville/Grinderswitch with Kenneth Thompson -- Kenneth Thompson presents Minnie Pearl with a plaque from the CB Club -- Careless Love (Minnie Pearl) -- Fender Banjo commercial (incomplete) -- Tennessee Pride commercial (Ira Louvin) -- Union 76 Opry opening statement ([Unidentified]) -- [Unidentified] introduces Roy Acuff -- Night Train To Memphis (Roy Acuff and the Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Roy Acuff talks (incomplete) -- Cracker Barrel Show opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Turner talks about Cracker Barrel -- Turner introduces Ernest Tubb -- Bubbles In My Beer (Ernest Tubb) (incomplete) [record excerpt] -- Turner introduces Loretta Lynn -- Somebody Somewhere (Loretta Lynn) (incomplete) [record excerpt] -- Turner talks about Loretta Lynn and introduces Johnny Cash -- Folsom Prison Blues (Johnny Cash) (incomplete) [record excerpt] -- Turner talks about Cracker Barrel mail order catalogue -- Turner introduces George Jones -- Her Name Is (George Jones) (incomplete) [record excerpt] -- Turner talks about Cracker Barrel -- Mercy Ain't Love Good (Jean Shepard) (incomplete) [record excerpt] -- Turner talks about Cracker Barrel locations in Tennessee -- Turner introduces Roy Wiggins -- Mr. Ting-A-Ling (Curtis Young and Roy Wiggins) (incomplete) [record excerpt] -- Closing statement (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Smith, Connie, 1941-; Tubb, Justin; Minnie Pearl; Cannon, Sarah Ophelia, 1912-1996; Louvin, Ira, 1924-1965; Acuff, Roy, 1903-1992; Smoky Mountain Boys; Turner, Grant;
